DataElement.preferredName: Patient Timed Up And Go Assessment Time Second Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of seconds related to the Timed "Up and Go" assessment.  The assessment measures the time it takes for an individual to stand up from a standard arm chair, walk a distance of 3 meters, turn, walk back to the chair, and sit down again.  (Reference: Timed "Up and Go".  D. Podsiadio and S. Richardson, 1991)

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Timed Up And Go Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the Timed "Up and Go" assessment.  The assessment measures the time it takes for an individual to stand up from a standard arm chair, walk a distance of 3 meters, turn, walk back to the chair, and sit down again.  (Reference: Timed "Up and Go".  D. Podsiadio and S. Richardson, 1991)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric value with no fractional part to represent a value of seconds._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:The second is the unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour. Abbreviation Sec. is acceptable in non-scientific usage only.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
